intro: Grumilea aruwimiensis, commonly known as the Aruwimi grumilea, is a rare flowering plant native to the rainforests of the Democratic Republic of the Congo. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and other tropical hardwoods. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters.
